wikipedia_page.main: John Wodehouse, 1st Earl of Kimberley  (7 January 1826 – 8 April 1902), known as The Lord Wodehouse from 1846 to 1866, was a British Liberal politician. He held office in every Liberal administration from 1852 to 1895, notably as Secretary of State for the Colonies and as Foreign Secretary.

response: * April 8 – John Wodehouse, 1st Earl of Kimberley, British politician (b. 1826)
*John Wodehouse, 1st Earl of Kimberley (1826–1902), a Whig and Liberal politician after whom Kimberley, South Africa was named, was born in Wymondham.
